attributes.action: order the arrest of Pope Benedict XVI should he incite homophobic violence during his visit to the UK in September.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
While we, the undersigned, recognise the right of the leader of a major religion to visit its followers in the UK, Pope Benedict XVI has a history of encouraging homophobic violence.

For instance, on 23 December 2008, the Pope declared that "saving humanity from homosexual or transexual behaviour is just as important as saving the rainforest from destruction". (http://www.bbc.co.uk/worldservice/news/2008/12/081223_pope_gay_forest_sl.shtml)

In the event that such comments likely to incite violence are repeated, we the undersigned petition the Prime Minister not to fail in ordering the arrest of Pope Benedict XVI.

rejection.details: The PM can not order an 'arrest'.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
